tn.ref: This is the word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh
tn.text: "This is what Yahweh said to Jeremiah"

tn.ref: was imprisoned in the courtyard of the guard
tn.text: "They put him in the prison in the courtyard of the guard" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the courtyard of the guard at the house of the king of Judah
tn.text: This was an open area attached to the king's palace.

tn.ref: Why do you prophesy and say
tn.text: Zekekiah uses a question to rebuke Jeremiah. AT: "It is wrong for you to continue prophesying and saying" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he will capture it
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to power or control. AT: "to the king of Babylon, and his army will capture it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for he has indeed been given
tn.text: AT: "for I have indeed given him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: His mouth will speak to the king's mouth, and his eyes will see the king's eyes
tn.text: AT: "Zedekiah himself will see and directly speak with Nebuchadnezzar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
Here "you" is plural and refers to the people in Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: The word of Yahweh came to
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:2]].
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:1]].
Jeremiah continues speaking.
"17 shekels." A shekel is 11 grams. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Jeremiah continues speaking.

tn.ref: in a scroll and sealed it, and had witnesses witness it
tn.text: This refers to the deed that a person would sign to purchase land. Other people would be witnesses to confirm that I had puchased this land.
"had witnesses there to see that I purchased the land"
"that I sealed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"opened copy" or "the deed that did not have a seal on it"
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:32:01|32:2]].
Jeremiah continues speaking.
Here "them" refers to Hanamel, the witnesses, and the Judeans.

tn.ref: Take these scrolls with the receipt of this purchase that is sealed and this unsealed scroll
tn.text: "Take the sealed scroll and the unsealed scroll"

tn.ref: Houses, fields, and vineyards will be purchased again in this land
tn.text: AT: "The people of Israel will buy houses, vineyards and fields again in this land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Jeremiah continues speaking.
This means the sealed scroll and the unsealed scroll.
"Alas"

tn.ref: by your great strength and with your raised arm
tn.text: The phrase "raised arm" is an idiomatic way of referring to strength. The two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize the greatness of Yahweh's power. AT: "by your very great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"You keep your promise and show your faithful love"

tn.ref: and pour the guilt of men into the laps of their children after them
tn.text: "and you punish children for the sin of their parents" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Jeremiah continues praying to Yahweh.

tn.ref: for your eyes are open to all the ways of people
tn.text: AT: "You see everything that people do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: to give to each man what his conduct and deeds deserve
tn.text: "and will reward everyone according to the things they do"

tn.ref: You did signs and wonders in the land of Egypt
tn.text: This refers to an event in the past when God used his power to free the people of Israel from slavery in Egypt.
"To this day"
"and among all people"

tn.ref: you have made your name famous
tn.text: Here "name" refers to God's reputation. AT: "you have made yourself famous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: with a strong hand, with a raised arm
tn.text: Both of these phrases are idiomatic ways of referring to strength. Together the phrases emphasize the greatness of Yahweh's power. AT: "with your great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Jeremiah continues praying to Yahweh.
"gave the people of Israel"

tn.ref: a land flowing with milk and honey
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:11:03|11:5]].

tn.ref: But they did not obey your voice
tn.text: AT: "But they did not obey what you said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Jeremiah continues praying to Yahweh.
"so the enemy army can capture it"
Here sword means war or fighting. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the city has been given into the hand of the Chaldeans
tn.text: Here "hand" means power or control. AT: "you have given Jerusalem to the Chaldean army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"and let other people witness it"
AT: "I am giving this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: This is the word of Yahweh that came to Jeremiah and said
tn.text: "This is what Yahweh said to Jeremiah"

tn.ref: Is anything too difficult for me to do?
tn.text: Yahweh uses a question to emphasize that he can do anything. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: into the hand of the Chaldeans
tn.text: Here "hand" refers to power or control. AT: "to the Chaldeans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh continues speaking to Jeremiah.
"which made me very angry"
AT: "doing what I consider evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"from the time that they became a nation" (UDB)
AT: "the evil things they have done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This verse is a continuation from the previous chunk.

tn.ref: this city has been a provocation of my wrath and fury since the day that they built it.
tn.text: The words "wrath" and "fury" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of his wrath. AT: "the people of Jerusalem have made me very angry since the day they built their city." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: It has been that right up to this present day
tn.text: AT: "They continue to make me angry even now"
AT: "from my presence" or "completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Yahweh continues speaking to Jeremiah.

tn.ref: They turned their backs to me instead of their faces
tn.text: AT: "My people ignored me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"to learn from me"
"their idols which I hate"

tn.ref: the house where my name was called
tn.text: AT: "the house that belongs to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:07:31|7:31]].
Here "mind" refers to Yahweh's thoughts. AT: "Something that I never considered doing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "you" is plural. Possible meanings are 1) this refers to Jeremiah and those with him, or 2) it refers to all the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: It is given into the hand of the king of Babylon
tn.text: Here "hand" means power or control. AT: "Yahweh has given it to the king of Babylon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"to gather my people"
All three words mean the same thing and emphasize the intensity of his anger. AT: "extreme anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Yahweh continues speaking.

tn.ref: one heart and one way to honor me
tn.text: This means there will be unity among the people of Israel and they will worship only Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"eternal agreement"

tn.ref: I will not turn away from doing good to them
tn.text: AT: "I will always do good to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])

tn.ref: so that they will never turn away from me
tn.text: AT: "so that they will always obey and worship me"
Yahweh continues speaking.
Here "them" refers to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: I will faithfully plant them in this land
tn.text: AT: "I will permanently settle the Israelites in this land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: with all my heart and all my life
tn.text: Together, these two phrases form an idiomatic expression that refers to a person's entire being. AT: "with all that I am" or "wholeheartedly." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Then fields will be bought in this land
tn.text: AT: "Then people will buy fields in this land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "you" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: It has been given over into the hand of the Chaldeans
tn.text: Here "hand" means power or control. AT: "Yahweh has given it to the Chaldeans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: write in sealed scrolls. They will assemble witnesses
tn.text: This refers to the deed that a person would sign to purchase land. Other people would be witnesses to confirm the purchase.

tn.ref: For I will bring back their fortunes
tn.text: "For I will make them prosper again"
